page.title: 07Flora Dance in Grampound
page.content: The Flora Dance is a traditional Cornish village dance.People dance it once a year to celebrate things.We dance the Flora to celebrate the end of a school year. You dance with a partner.You walk 3 steps then hop.This is done 8 times then you turn to the couple behind you.Still doing the basic step of 1,2,3,hop you join hands to form a star.You circle to the right for 4 phrases of the music then 4 more to the left.The whole dance then starts again.We start the dance in the playground then we go all through the main street of the village.Every child in the school dances the Flora and all our parents join in too.It is great fun.The Infants carry decorated hoops.All the girls wear flowers in their hair and the boys wear flowers in their button holes.
